Not me but a friend from the Spanish community. We are actually discussing Backdrop on cPanel the next online meetup

Not me but a friend from the Spanish community. We are actually discussing Backdrop on cPanel the next online meetup

At first I thought you were discussing using cPanel automatic installation of Backdrop CMS using tools like Softaculous. But, maybe you are simply talking about how to install and manage a site on a shared host using cPanel?

If we don't already have good instructions for this, we should make sure that they exist. If anyone is having difficulty installing Backdrop CMS, I think it would be great to post questions in the forum. The forum is the place that most new users are likely to look for this advice (outside of BackdropCMS.org), so it would be great to answer questions there.
Can't find Backdrop in softaculous

Any cPanel webhost that uses Softaculous.
Aha! Seems Bluehost has just switched to Softaculous. They're easily one of the largest shared hosting providers, if not the largest.

How do we find out what other hosts use Softaculous?

I think I'm going to fire up a Bluehost account and see if I can install Backdrop from an installer -- that would be sweet!

(I think it would make sense for us to track what that experience is like for end-users, so that we can support them appropriately and help them have a good experience with it.)

Re this line in the description:

...Classes and we are still adding more

I think either the we needs to be replaced with they, or it should read something more like this:

...Classes and still more are being added.
Thanks @oadaeh (Jason Flatt) :+1: ...that was a direct copy-paste from their site. I went with your second suggestion.

...on second thought, I trimmed the whole thing about number of scripts/classes out, into this simplified version:

Softaculous is the leading Auto Installer, widely used in the Web Hosting industry, and it has helped millions of users install applications by the click of a button. Softaculous Auto Installer easily integrates into leading Control Panels like cPanel, Plesk, DirectAdmin, InterWorx, H-Sphere.

@jenlampton @StPaulTim or @BWPanda it seems that the "try backdrop" view was ordering entries by post date ...I've changed that to be random (I thought that that's how it always has been in order to be fair to every one of these service providers - did we change that?)

Yep, alphabetical should be better.
